On 14 August, after being captured by the Al Nusra Front, the [[Free Syrian Army]] commander Sharif As-Safouri admitted to working with Israel and receiving [[Anti-tank warfare|anti-tank]] weapons from Israel and FSA soldiers also received medical treatment. It is possible this confession was obtained under duress.{{cite web |url=http://www.abna.ir/english/service/middle-east-west-asia/archive/2014/08/14/631067/story.html |title=Syrian militant commander admits collaboration with Israel |date=14 August 2014 |accessdate=2 October 2014}} On 14 August, the [[Syrian Army]] as well as [[Hezbollah]] militias retook the town of Mleiha in [[Rif Dimashq Governorate]]. The Supreme Military Council of the FSA denied claims of Mleiha's seizure, rather the rebels have redeployed from recent advances to other defensive lines.{{cite web |url=http://eaworldview.com/2014/08/syria-daily-insurgents-doomed-aleppo/#mleiha2 |title=Syria Daily, August 14: Are Insurgents Doomed in Aleppo? |work=EA WorldView |accessdate=2 October 2014}} Mleiha has been held by the [[Islamic Front (Syria)|Islamic Front]]. Rebels had used the town to fire mortars on government held areas inside Damascus.{{cite news |url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2014/08/14/uk-syria-crisis-town-idUKKBN0GE0MN20140814 |title=Syrian army takes town near Damascus in blow to rebels |agency=Reuters UK |accessdate=1 April 2015 |date=14 August 2014}}{{cite web |url=http://english.alarabiya.net/en/News/middle-east/2014/08/13/ISIS-militants-seize-more-territory-in-Syria-.html |title=en/News/middle-east/2014/08/13/ISIS-militants-seize-more-territory-in-Syria- |publisher=Al Arabiya |accessdate=21 October 2015}} Meanwhile, ISIL forces in Raqqa were launching a siege on [[Battle for Tabqa Air base|Tabqa airbase]], the Syrian government's last military base in Raqqa. Kuwaires airbase in [[Aleppo]] also came under fierce attack by ISIL.{{cite news |url=http://www.indianmonitor.com/index.php/world/item/49001-islamic-militants-crush-tribal-uprising-in-syria-washington-post |title=Islamic militants crush tribal uprising in Syria |via=Indian Monitor |date=11 August 2014 |work=The Washington Post |accessdate=7 June 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150626154414/http://www.indianmonitor.com/index.php/world/item/49001-islamic-militants-crush-tribal-uprising-in-syria-washington-post |archivedate=26 June 2015}}
{{cite web |url=https://www.facebook.com/syriahroe/posts/568805753227767 |title=Aleppo province: a man was killed with... – Syrian Observatory for Human Rights – Facebook |accessdate=2 October 2014}} On 16 August 2014, there were reports that 22 people were killed in the village of [[Daraa]] by a [[car bomb]] outside a mosque. The bomb was thought to be detonated by ISIS. Also on 16 August, the Islamic State seized the village of Beden in Aleppo Governorate from rebels.{{cite web |url=http://news.uk.msn.com/world/22-killed-in-syria-car-bomb-blast |title=World |publisher=MSN |accessdate=2 October 2014}} On 17 August 2014, SOHR said that in the past two weeks ISIL jihadists had killed over 700 tribal members in oil-rich [[Deir ez-Zor Governorate]].{{cite web |url=http://www.naharnet.com/stories/en/143590-is-killed-more-than-700-syria-tribe-members-in-2-weeks |title=IS Killed More than 700 Syria Tribe Members in 2 Weeks |work=Naharnet |accessdate=2 October 2014}} On 19 August, Abu Abdullah al-Iraqi, a senior figure in ISIL who had helped prepare and plan car and suicide bombs across Syria, Lebanon, and Iraq was killed. Some reports said that he was killed by Hezbollah fighters. There were also several reports that he was killed by the Syrian Army in the Qalamoun region, near the border with Lebanon.{{cite web |url=https://news.yahoo.com/lebanons-hezbollah-kills-top-jihadist-syria-ngo-102414478.html |title=Lebanon's Hezbollah kills top jihadist in Syria: NGO |date=19 August 2014 |work=Yahoo News |accessdate=2 October 2014}}
{{cite web |url=http://www.abna.ir/english/service/middle-east-west-asia/archive/2014/08/19/632095/story.html |title=ISIL commander 'Abu Abdullah al-Iraqi' killed in Syrian army operation: report |date=19 August 2014 |accessdate=2 October 2014}}
{{cite web |url=http://www.dailystar.com.lb/News/Middle-East/2014/Aug-19/267659-isis-commander-killed-by-syrian-army-report.ashx |title=Hezbollah kills suicide bombing plotter: activists |work=The Daily Star Newspaper – Lebanon |accessdate=2 October 2014}} In Raqqa, the Syrian Army took control of the town of Al-Ejeil.{{cite web |url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2014/08/islamic-state-syria-raqqa-2014823142435185199.html |title=Syrian army repels Islamic State attack |accessdate=2 October 2014}}
{{cite web |url=http://www.almanar.com.lb/english/adetails.php?fromval=1&cid=23&frid=23&eid=167132 |title=Third ISIL Attempt to Seize Tabaqa Airport Fails |accessdate=2 October 2014}} ISIL reportedly sent reinforcements from Iraq to the governorate of Raqqa. The Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said at least 400 ISIL fighters had also been wounded in the previous five days in clashes with the Syrian Army and [[National Defence Force (Syria)|National Defense Force]] in Raqqa alone.{{cite web |url=http://www.dawn.com/news/1127375/isis-begins-push-to-seize-syrian-air-base |title=ISIS begins push to seize Syrian air base |agency=Agence France-Presse |accessdate=2 October 2014}} At the same time, several senior UK and US figures urged Turkey to stop allowing ISIL to cross the border to Syria and Iraq.{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/aug/23/us-air-strikes-isis-commanders-syria-considered |title=US 'set to launch air strikes' on senior Isis terror chiefs in Syria – World news – The Observer |author=Toby Helm |work=The Guardian |accessdate=2 October 2014}} It was around this time that the Americans realized that the Turks had no intention of sealing their side of the border, and so Washington decided to work with the Syrian Kurds to close off the border on the Syrian side.{{cite news |title=Turkish threats of intervention after Ankara bombing taken seriously by Obama |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/syria-conflict-isis-turkey-barack-obama-ankara-bombing-a6886466.html |accessdate=21 February 2016 |date=20 February 2016 |last=Cockburn |first=Patrick}} A year later, with the Kurds in control of most of the Turkey–Syria border, and the Syrian army advancing under Russian air support to seal the remainder, the situation was causing great ructions in Ankara.{{Cite news |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-syria-kurds-idUSKCN0VQ1FR |title=Kurds' advance in Syria divides U.S. and Turkey as Russia bombs |last=Butler |first=Daren |date=17 February 2016 |accessdate=21 February 2016 |agency=Reuters}} On 26 August 2014, the Syrian Air Force carried out airstrikes against ISIL in the Governorate of Deir ez-Zor. This was the first time the Syrian Army attacked them in [[Deir ez-Zor]] as the Syrian Army pulled out of Raqqa and shifted to Deir ez-Zor for its oil and natural gas resources as well as strategically splitting ISIL territories.{{cite web |url=http://zeenews.india.com/news/world/syria-war-planes-hit-jihadist-sites-in-deir-ezzor_1460674.html |title=Syria war planes hit jihadist sites in Deir Ezzor |work=Zee News |accessdate=2 October 2014}}
{{cite web |url=http://www.almanar.com.lb/english/adetails.php?eid=167649&frid=23&seccatid=20&cid=23&fromval=1 |title=Syria Warplanes Strike ISIL Sites in Deir Ezour, Army Operates across Country |accessdate=2 October 2014}} American jets began bombing ISIL in Syria on 23 September 2014, raising U.S. involvement in the country. At least 20 targets in and around Raqqa were hit, the opposition group Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said. Foreign partners participating in the strikes with the United States were Bahrain, Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates, Qatar and Jordan. The U.S. and "partner nation forces" began striking ISIL using fighters, bombers and Tomahawk missiles, Pentagon spokesman Rear Adm. John Kirby said.{{cite news |url=http://edition.cnn.com/2014/09/22/world/meast/u-s-airstrikes-isis-syria/index.html?hpt=hp_t1 |title=U.S. airstrikes hit ISIS targets inside Syria – CNN.com |date=23 September 2014 |publisher=CNN |accessdate=2 October 2014}} ==== US intervention in Raqqa and Kobani ==== {{Main|Timeline of the Syrian Civil War (August–December 2014)|2014 American intervention in Syria}} [[File:Coalition Airstrike on ISIL position in Kobane.jpg|220px|thumb|wright|Coalition airstrike in Kobanî on ISIL position, October 2014]] U.S. aircraft include [[B-1 bomber]]s, [[F-16]]s, [[F-18]]s and [[Predator drones]], with F-18s flying missions off the {{USS|George H.W. Bush|CVN-77}} in the Persian Gulf. [[Tomahawk missiles]] were fired from the destroyer {{USS|Arleigh Burke|DDG-51}} in the [[Red Sea]]. Syria's Foreign Ministry told the Associated Press that the U.S. informed Syria's envoy to the U.N. that "strikes will be launched against the terrorist group in Raqqa".{{cite news |url=http://www.foxnews.com/politics/2014/09/23/us-launches-first-wave-bombing-strikes-over-syria/ |title=US, Arab allies launch first wave of strikes in Syria |publisher=Fox News Channel |accessdate=2 October 2014 |date=23 September 2014}} The United States informed the Free Syrian Army beforehand of the impending airstrikes, and the rebels said that weapons transfers to the Free Syrian Army had begun.{{cite news |url=https://online.wsj.com/articles/syria-opposition-says-it-was-informed-strikes-would-begin-1411459825 |title=Syria Rebels Say They Were Told of Airstrikes Against Islamic State |date=23 September 2014 |work=The Wall Street Journal |accessdate=2 October 2014 |first=Maria |last=Abi-Habib}} The United States also attacked a specific faction of al-Nusra called the [[Khorasan (Islamist group)|Khorasan Group]], who according to the United States had training camps and plans for attacking the United States in the future.{{cite web |url=http://eaworldview.com/2014/09/syria-daily-us-airstrikes-missiles-hit-islamic-state/#kobane |title=Syria Daily, Sept 23: US Airstrikes & Missiles Hit Islamic State |work=EA WorldView |accessdate=2 October 2014}} For its part, Turkey launched an official request to the U.N. for a no-fly zone over Syria.{{cite web |url=http://english.yenisafak.com/world/erdogan-asks-un-for-no-fly-zone-over-syria-2024442 |title=Erdogan asks UN for no-fly zone over Syria |accessdate=2 October 2014}} The same day, Israel shot down a Syrian warplane after it entered the Golan area from Quneitra.{{cite web |url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/1.617329 |title=IDF shoots down Syrian fighter plane infiltrating Israeli territory |date=23 September 2014 |work=Haaretz |accessdate=2 October 2014}} By 3 October 2014, ISIL forces were [[Siege of Kobanê|heavily shelling the city of Kobanî]] and were within a kilometer of the town.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-29474879 |title=BBC News Islamic State steps up attack on Syrian town of Kobane |work=BBC News|accessdate=14 October 2014 |date=4 October 2014}} Within 36 hours from 21 October, the Syrian air force carried out over 200 airstrikes on rebel-held areas across Syria and US and Arab jets attacked IS positions around Kobanî. Syrian Information Minister [[Omran al-Zoubi]] said the YPG forces in Kobanî had been provided with military and logistical support.{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2803457/Syria-destroys-two-warplanes-used-ISIS-train-fighter-pilots-terrorist-airforce.html |title=Syria destroys two warplanes used by ISIS to train fighter pilots |work=Daily Mailaccessdate=23 October 2014 |location=London |date=22 October 2014}}
{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-29720384 |title=BBC News Syria conflict: '200 air force strikes' in 36 hours |work=BBC News|accessdate=23 October 2014 |date=22 October 2014}} Syria reported its air force had destroyed two fighter jets operated by IS.{{cite news |url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2014/10/22/uk-mideast-crisis-syria-jets-idUKKCN0IB1H220141022 |title=Syria says shoots down two of three Islamic State jets |author=Oliver Holmes |agency=Reuters |date=22 October 2014 |accessdate=26 October 2014}} By 26 January, the Kurdish YPG forced ISIL to retreat from Kobanî,{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-30991612 |title=Syrian Kurds 'drive Islamic State out of Kobane' |date=26 January 2015 |accessdate=26 January 2015 |work=BBC News}} thus fully recapturing the city.{{cite web |url=http://syriahr.com/en/2015/01/ypg-retakes-the-entire-city-of-ayn-al-arab-kobani-after-112-days-of-clashes-with-is-militants-2/ |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151016201939/http://www.syriahr.com/en/2015/01/ypg-retakes-the-entire-city-of-ayn-al-arab-kobani-after-112-days-of-clashes-with-is-militants-2/ |archivedate=16 October 2015 |deadurl=yes |title=YPG retakes the entire city of Ayn al- Arab "Kobani" after 112 days of clashes with IS militants |author=sohranas |work=Syrian Observatory For Human Rights |accessdate=27 January 2015}} The U.S. later confirmed that the city had been cleared of ISIL forces,{{cite news |url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2015/01/31/uk-mideast-crisis-syria-kobani-idUKKBN0L40U820150131?rpc=401 |title=U.S. general says Syrian town of Kobani taken from Islamic State |agency=Reuters |accessdate=31 January 2015 |first=Mohammad |last=Zargham |date=31 January 2015}} and ISIL admitted defeat in Kobanî city three days later, although they vowed to return.{{cite news |url=http://www.ctvnews.ca/world/isis-admits-kobani-defeat-after-u-s-led-airstrike-campaign-in-syria-1.2214806 |title=ISIS admits Kobani defeat after U.S.-led airstrike campaign in Syria |date=31 January 2015 |accessdate=31 January 2015 |publisher=CTV News |agency=Associated Press |quote=Members of the Islamic State group have acknowledged for the first time that they were defeated in the Syrian town of Kobani.}} ==== The Southern Front and northern Army of Conquest (October 2014 – June 2015) ==== In February 2014, the [[Southern Front (Syrian rebel group)|Southern Front of the Free Syrian Army]] formed in southern Syria. Six months later, they started a string of victories in Daraa and Quneitra during the [[2014 Quneitra offensive]], the [[Daraa offensive (October 2014)|Daraa offensive]], the [[Battle of Al-Shaykh Maskin]], the [[Battle of Bosra (2015)]] and the [[Battle of Nasib Border Crossing]]. A government counter-offensive (the [[2015 Southern Syria offensive]]) during this period, that included the [[Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps|IRGC]] and [[Hezbollah]], recaptured 15 towns, villages and hills,{{cite web |url=http://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/originals/2015/02/regime-syria-daraa-southern-front-opposition.html |title=Syria opposition forces claim regime attack in Daraa futile |publisher=Al Monitor |accessdate=20 February 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150221143418/http://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/originals/2015/02/regime-syria-daraa-southern-front-opposition.html |archivedate=21 February 2015 |df=dmy-all }}
{{cite web |url=http://syriahr.com/en/2015/03/26-members-of-the-regime-forces-and-allied-militiamen-killed-today/ |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150915174801/http://www.syriahr.com/en/2015/03/26-members-of-the-regime-forces-and-allied-militiamen-killed-today/ |archivedate=15 September 2015 |deadurl=yes |title=26 members of the regime forces and allied militiamen killed today |author=sohranas |work=Syrian Observatory For Human Rights |accessdate=4 March 2015 }}
{{cite web |url=https://twitter.com/EjmAlrai/status/572311004123680768 |title=Elijah J. Magnier on Twitter |work=Twitter |accessdate=4 March 2015 }} but the operation slowed soon after{{cite news |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2015/04/02/us-mideast-crisis-syria-idUSKBN0MT1R420150402 |title=As regional war rages, Syria's Assad faces setbacks |last1=Perry |first1=Tom |last2=Al-Khalidi |first2=Suleiman |agency=Reuters |date=2 April 2015 |accessdate=14 April 2015 |quote=But the offensive stalled after some early but limited gains}} and stalled.{{cite web |url=http://www.csmonitor.com/World/Middle-East/2015/0311/Syrian-rebels-march-on-Damascus-becomes-fight-for-their-survival |title=Syrian rebels' march on Damascus becomes fight for their survival (+video) |author=Taylor Luck |work=The Christian Science Monitor |accessdate=15 April 2015}} Since early 2015, opposition military operations rooms based in Jordan and Turkey began increasing cooperation,{{cite news |url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/16a10034-df6c-11e4-b6da-00144feab7de.html |title=Syria's rebels heartened by healing of Sunni Arab rifts |last1=Solomon |first1=Erika |last2=Kerr |first2=Simeon |work=Financial Times |date=13 April 2015 |accessdate=13 April 2015 |quote=In the south, opposition forces foiled an offensive led by regime allies [...] for the first time since their revolution began, rebels note that advances in the north and south are coinciding, and their backers' two operating rooms – one in Turkey used by Ankara and Doha, and another in Jordan used more by Saudi Arabia and Western allies – appear to be co-ordinating}} with Saudi Arabia and Qatar also reportedly agreeing upon the necessity to unite opposition factions against the Syrian government.{{cite news |url=http://www.csmonitor.com/World/Middle-East/2015/0421/Can-Syria-s-Assad-withstand-latest-battlefield-setbacks-video |title=Can Syria's Assad withstand latest battlefield setbacks? (+video) |work=The Christian Science Monitor |last=Blanford |first=Nicholas |date=21 August 2015 |accessdate=22 April 2015 |quote=The regime's recent setbacks in Idlib and the south are due in part to Assad's regional enemies – including Saudi Arabia, Turkey, Qatar, and Jordan – agreeing on the need to unite rebel factions to oust Assad, according to analysts and regional diplomats.}} In late October 2014, a conflict erupted between the al-Nusra Front on one side and the Western-backed [[Syria Revolutionaries Front|SRF]] and [[Hazzm Movement]] on the other ([[Al-Nusra Front–SRF/Hazzm Movement conflict]]). By the end of February 2015, al-Nusra had defeated both groups, captured the entire [[Zawiya Mountain]] region in Idlib province and several towns and military bases in other governorates, and seized weapons supplied by the [[Central Intelligence Agency|CIA]] to the two moderate groups.{{cite news |url=http://www.mcclatchydc.com/2014/11/01/245423_in-setback-islamic-state-nusra.html |title=US-backed forces in Syria suffer big setback |date=1 November 2014 |accessdate=3 November 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141207001145/http://www.mcclatchydc.com/2014/11/01/245423_in-setback-islamic-state-nusra.html |archivedate=7 December 2014}}
{{cite news |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/us-backed-syria-rebels-routed-by-fighters-linked-to-al-qaeda/2014/11/02/7a8b1351-8fb7-4f7e-a477-66ec0a0aaf34_story.html |title=U.S.-backed Syria rebels routed by fighters linked to al-Qaeda |date=2 November 2014 |accessdate=3 November 2014 |work=The Washington Post |first=Liz |last=Sly}} The significant amount of weapons seized included a small number of [[BGM-71]] anti-tank missiles similar to weapons systems al-Nusra Front had previously captured from government stockpiles such as French [[MILAN]]s, Chinese [[HJ-8]]s and Russian [[9K111 Fagot]]s.{{cite news |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/checkpoint/wp/2014/12/15/al-qaeda-faction-in-syria-claims-to-have-u-s-supplied-anti-tank-weapon/ |title=Al-Qaeda faction in Syria claims to have U.S.-supplied anti-tank weapon |work=The Washington Post |first1=Thomas |last1=Gibbons-Neff |date=15 December 2014 |accessdate=3 June 2015 |quote=The fielding of a TOW system would not necessarily provide al-Nusra with a capability it didn't already have. Similar weapons systems such as the Chinese HJ-8, French Milan and the Russian Spigot have all been seen in operation in Syria.}} Reuters reported that this represented al-Nusra crushing pro-Western rebels in the north of the country.{{cite news |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2015/04/14/us-mideast-crisis-syria-south-idUSKBN0N511N20150414?irpc=932 |title=Southern Syria rebels set collision course with al Qaeda |agency=Reuters |date=14 April 2015}} According to FSA commanders in northern Syria, however, the elimination of Harakat Hazm and the SRF was a welcome development due to the leaders of those factions allegedly involved in corruption.{{cite news |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/charles-lister/an-internal-struggle-al-q_b_7479730.html |title=An Internal Struggle: Al Qaeda's Syrian Affiliate Is Grappling With Its Identity |work=HuffPost |last=Lister |first=Charles |date=1 June 2015 |accessdate=1 June 2015 |quote=But not all saw it the same way, especially when it came to the fighting against the SRF and Harakat Hazm. One FSA commander exclaimed to this author that "Jamal Maarouf was a criminal and his group was unpopular," while another such leader told this author in February 2015 that "Hazm's destruction cannot come soon enough, they have done nothing but cause trouble in Aleppo." [...] Having spoken extensively with leading commanders from across the Syrian spectrum in recent weeks, it is clear this [Army of Conquest] cooperation has at least partly been motivated by a desire to ensure victories in Idlib do not become strategic gains for al Qaeda.}} The Western-backed [[New Syrian Forces|30th Division]] of the FSA remained active elsewhere in Idlib.{{cite web |url=https://iwpr.net/global-voices/after-syrian-armys-defeat-people-trickle-back |title=After Syrian Army's Defeat, People Trickle Back to Idlib Towns |publisher=IWPR |last=al-Akla |first=Ahmad |date=8 May 2015 |accessdate=29 May 2015}} By 24 March 2015, the al-Nusra Front dominated most of Idlib province, except for the government-held provincial capital, [[Idlib]], which they had encircled on three sides along with their Islamist allies.{{cite web |url=http://carnegie-mec.org/2015/03/24/nusra-front-s-game-changing-rise-in-syria/i4v0 |title=The Nusra Front's Game-Changing Rise in Syria |publisher=Carnegie Middle East Center |accessdate=21 September 2015}} Therefore, they joined together to form the [[Army of Conquest]] on this day.{{cite web |url=http://syriadirect.org/rss/1941-syria-direct-news-update-3-25-15 |publisher=Syria Direct |accessdate=25 March 2015 |title=News Update 3-25-15}} On 28 March, a joint coalition of Islamist forces, the [[Army of Conquest]], captured Idlib.{{cite web |url=http://www.france24.com/en/20150330-islamists-syria-seize-idlib-nusra-jaish-fath |title=Middle East – New Islamist alliance seizes Idlib from Syrian troops |publisher=France 24}}
{{cite web |url=http://uk.blastingnews.com/politics/2015/03/new-islamist-alliance-captures-syrian-regional-capital-idlib-from-government-forces-00328405.html |title=New Islamist alliance captures Syrian regional capital Idlib from government forces |author=Blasting News |work=Blasting News}}
{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/middleeast/syria/11502899/Thousands-flee-Syrian-city-Idlib-after-rebel-capture.html |title=Thousands flee Syrian city Idlib after rebel capture |date=29 March 2015 |accessdate=1 April 2015 |location=London |work=The Daily Telegraph}} This left the north largely taken over by [[Ahrar ash-Sham]], al-Nusra Front and other Islamist rebels, with the south of the country becoming the last significant foothold for the mainstream, non-jihadist opposition fighters.{{cite news |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2015/04/02/us-mideast-crisis-syria-idUSKBN0MT1R420150402 |title=As regional war rages, Syria's Assad faces setbacks |agency=Reuters |date=2 April 2015}} {{Main|Northwestern Syria offensive (April–June 2015)|Second Battle of Idlib}} On 22 April, [[Northwestern Syria offensive (April–June 2015)|a new rebel offensive]] was launched in the north-west of Syria and by 25 April, the rebel coalition [[Army of Conquest]] had captured the city of [[Jisr al-Shughur]].{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-32461693 |title=Syria conflict: Islamists capture Jisr al-Shughur |work=BBC News}} At the end of the following month, the rebels also seized the [[Al-Mastumah]] military base,{{cite web |url=http://www.syriahr.com/en/2015/05/after-al-mastomi-town-and-its-military-camp-al-fateh-army-expels-the-regime-forces-from-nihlaya/ |title=After al- Mastomi town and its military camp, Al- Fateh Army expels the regime forces from Nihlaya |author=sohranas |work=Syrian Observatory For Human Rights |accessdate=22 May 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150522083456/http://www.syriahr.com/en/2015/05/after-al-mastomi-town-and-its-military-camp-al-fateh-army-expels-the-regime-forces-from-nihlaya/ |archivedate=22 May 2015 |deadurl=yes}} and [[Ariha, Syria|Ariha]], leaving government forces in control of tiny pockets of Idlib, including the Abu Dhuhur military airport.{{cite web |url=http://www.dailystar.com.lb/News/Middle-East/2015/May-29/299703-rebels-take-ariha-from-assad.ashx |title=Rebels take Ariha from Assad |work=The Daily Star Newspaper – Lebanon}} In addition, according to Charles Lister (Brookings Doha Center), the Army of Conquest coalition was a broad opposition effort to ensure that the Al-Qaeda-affiliated al-Nusra Front was contained, with the rearguard involvement of Western-backed factions being regarded as crucial. Still, according to some, the FSA in northern Syria had by this point all but dissipated. Many of the moderate fighters joined more extremist organizations, such as [[Ahrar ash-Sham]], the largest faction in the Army of Conquest, which led to the subsequent rise of the Islamist Army of Conquest coalition.{{cite web |url=http://www.ibtimes.com/syrias-north-opposition-making-major-comeback-thanks-one-rebel-group-turkey-1975411 |title=In Syria's North, Opposition Is Making A Major Comeback Thanks To One Rebel Group, And To Turkey |author=Erin Banco |date=19 June 2015 |work=International Business Times}} Rebel advances led to government and Hezbollah morale plunging dramatically.{{cite news |title=Outside Powers Weigh Their Options in Syria |url=https://www.stratfor.com/sample/analysis/outside-powers-weigh-their-options-syria |agency=Stratfor |date=6 June 2015 |accessdate=6 June 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150613033409/https://www.stratfor.com/sample/analysis/outside-powers-weigh-their-options-syria |archivedate=13 June 2015 |df=dmy-all}} In north-west Syria these losses were countered by a Hezbollah-led offensive in the Qalamoun mountains north of Damascus, on the border with Lebanon, that gave Hezbollah effective control of the entire area.{{cite news |title=Hezbollah, Syrian army make big gains in border battle |url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2015/05/13/uk-mideast-crisis-syria-idUKKBN0NY0UM20150513 |agency=Reuters |date=13 May 2015 |accessdate=13 May 2015}} ==== Resurgent ISIL advance (May 2015 – September 2015) ==== {{Main|Palmyra offensive (May 2015)|Palmyra offensive (July–August 2015)}} On 21 May, ISIL took control of [[Palmyra]], a UNESCO World Heritage Site, after eight days of fighting.{{cite news |title=ISIS is 'everywhere' in Syria's ancient city of Palmyra |url=http://www.cnn.com/2015/05/21/middleeast/isis-syria-iraq/ |publisher=CNN |date=21 May 2015}} The jihadists also captured the nearby towns of Al-Sukhnah and Amiriya, as well as several oil fields.{{cite web |url=http://www.business-standard.com/article/news-ians/is-overruns-parts-of-unesco-listed-syrian-city-115052001311_1.html |title=IS overruns parts of Unesco-listed Syrian city |accessdate=20 May 2015}} Following the capture of Palmyra, ISIL conducted mass executions in the area, killing an estimated 217–329 government civilian supporters and soldiers, according to opposition activists.{{cite web |url=http://www.syriahr.com/en/2015/05/islamic-state-carry-out-its-moto-staying-and-explading-and-seizes-more-than-50-of-syria/ |title=Islamic State carries out its motto 'lasting and explading' and seizes more than 50% of Syria |author=sohranas |publisher=Syrian Observatory For Human Rights |accessdate=21 May 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150522164059/http://www.syriahr.com/en/2015/05/islamic-state-carry-out-its-moto-staying-and-explading-and-seizes-more-than-50-of-syria/ |archivedate=22 May 2015 |deadurl=yes}}
{{cite news |url=http://ca.reuters.com/article/topNews/idCAKBN0OA0CD20150525 |title=Syrian air force targets captured Palmyra city – monitor |agency=Reuters |date=25 May 2015}} Government sources put the number of killed at 400–450.{{cite web |url=http://www.thenational.ae/world/middle-east/syria-regime-launches-15-air-raids-around-palmyra |title=Syria regime launches 15 air raids around Palmyra |work=The National}} By early June, ISIL reached the town of Hassia, which lies on the main road from Damascus to Homs and Latakia, and reportedly took up positions to the west of it, creating a potential disaster for the government and raising the threat of Lebanon being sucked further into the war.{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/middleeast/syria/11663774/Assads-forces-defeated-on-roads-north-and-south.html |title=Assad's forces defeated on roads north and south |work=The Telegraph |last1=Spencer |first1=Richard |date=9 June 2015 |accessdate=10 June 2015 |quote=Meanwhile, Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant, attacked west from Palmyra, reached the town of Hassia on the main road north from Damascus to Homs and the coast. |location=London}} On 25 June, ISIL launched two offensives. One was a surprise diversionary attack on Kobanî, while the second targeted government-held parts of Al-Hasakah city.{{cite news |url=https://www.stratfor.com/analysis/islamic-state-launches-two-attacks-syria |title=Islamic State Launches Two Attacks in Syria |publisher=Stratfor |date=25 June 2015 |accessdate=25 June 2015 |quote=The Islamic State launched two attacks in northern Syria on June 25 [...] The second attack was directed against the parts of al-Hasaka city still occupied by forces loyal to Syrian President Bashar al Assad and Kurds in the northern part of town. The mainstream media has largely focused on the Kobanî attack, but the al-Hasaka operation in the northeast is more important by far.}} The ISIL offensive on Al-Hasakah displaced 60,000 people, with the UN estimating a total of 200,000 would be displaced.{{cite news |url=http://www.thestar.com.my/News/World/2015/06/26/Islamic-State-attack-in-northeast-Syria-reported-to-displace-60000--UN/ |title=Islamic State attack in northeast Syria reported to displace 60,000 – UN |work=The Star |agency=Reuters |date=26 June 2015 |accessdate=26 June 2015}} In July 2015, a raid by U.S. special forces on a compound housing the Islamic State's "chief financial officer", [[Abu Sayyaf (ISIL)|Abu Sayyaf]], produced evidence that [[Turkish involvement in the Syrian Civil War|Turkish]] officials directly dealt with ranking ISIS members.{{cite news |last1=Bertrand |first1=Natasha |title=Senior Western official: Links between Turkey and ISIS are now 'undeniable' |url=http://www.businessinsider.com/links-between-turkey-and-isis-are-now-undeniable-2015-7 |work=Business Insider |date=28 July 2015}} ISIS captured [[Al-Qaryatayn|Qaryatayn]] city from the government on 5 August 2015.{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3186895/ISIS-seize-key-town-central-Syria-home-tens-thousands-Christians-terror-group-s-significant-advance-capturing-ancient-city-Palmyra.html |title=ISIS seize Qaryatain town in central Syria |date=6 August 2015 |accessdate=9 September 2015 |work=Daily Mail}} Australia joined the bombing of ISIL in Syria in mid September, an extension of their efforts in Iraq for the last year.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-australia-34265118 |title=Australia launches first air strikes inside Syria |work=BBC News|accessdate=21 October 2015}} On 2 August, U.S. officials informed Reuters that the United States had decided to "allow air strikes to help defend against any attack on the U.S.-trained Syrian rebels, even if the attackers come from forces loyal to Syrian President Bashar al-Assad." The following day the Pentagon announced that it would begin flying its first unmanned, [[Military drone|armed drone]] missions in Syria.{{cite web |url=http://www.businessinsider.com/the-us-says-it-will-defend-syria-rebels-with-airpower-even-from-assad-2015-8 |title=The US says it will defend Syria rebels with airpower — even from Assad |work=Business Insider}}
{{cite web |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-syria-usa-idUSKCN0Q803Y20150803 |title=First U.S.-trained Syria rebel believed killed in fighting: sources |date=3 August 2017 |agency=Reuters}} === Russian intervention and Aleppo offensive (30 September 2015 – February 2016) === {| class="navbox collapsible" style="float: right; margin: 0.8em; width:40em; font-size:x-small;" cellspacing="0" |- ! style="background:#F5F5F5; border:0 solid black;"|Russian military facilities involved in the war in Syria |- | {{Image label begin|image=Outline map of Middle East.svg|width=400}} {{Image label small|x=-195.0|y=-25.0|scale=-1|text=[[File:Red pog.svg|5x5px|Caspian Flotilla]] [[Caspian Flotilla]] [[Russian Navy]] ([[Astrakhan]])}} {{Image label small|x=-190.0|y=-40.0|scale=-1|text=[[File:Red pog.svg|5x5px|Caspian Flotilla]] [[Caspian Flotilla]] [[Russian Navy]] ([[Makhachkala]])}} {{Image label small|x=-190.0|y=-50.0|scale=-1|text=[[File:Red pog.svg|5x5px|Caspian Flotilla]] [[Caspian Flotilla]] [[Russian Navy]] ([[Kaspiysk]])}} {{Image label small|x=-132.0|y=-90.0|scale=-1|text=[[File:Red pog.svg|5x5px|Aircraft group]] {{Interlanguage link multi|Aircraft group|ru|3=Авиационная группа ВВС России в Сирии}} [[Russian Aerospace Forces|ASF RF]]}} {{Image label small|x=-130.0|y=-98.0|scale=-1|text=[[File:Red pog.svg|5x5px|Russian naval facility in Tartus]] [[Russian naval facility in Tartus|720th PL of the Russian Navy]]}} {{Image label end}} [[Russian Navy]]{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-34465425 |title=Russian missiles 'hit IS in Syria from Caspian Sea' |work=BBC News|date=7 October 2015}} | [[Russian Aerospace Forces]]{{cite web |url=//ria.ru/defense_safety/20150930/1292970356.html |title=The decision to use the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation abroad (Syria) |agency=RIA Novosti |language=russian |date=30 September 2015}} | {{Interlanguage link multi|Group Special forces|ru|3=Группа российских военных специалистов в Сирии}}{{cite web |url=https://www.rt.com/news/314831-russia-syria-military-advisors/ |title=Russian military advisers work in Syria, longtime military cooperation 'no secret' |publisher=RT |accessdate=21 October 2015}} |} {{See also|Russian military intervention in the Syrian Civil War|Northwestern Syria offensive (October 2015)|Aleppo offensive (October–December 2015)}} On 30 September 2015,[http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/us-confirms-russian-airstrikes-syria/story?id=34146198 "US Confirms Russian Airstrikes in Syria"], 30 September 2015. in response to an official request by the Syrian government,{{cite web |url=http://sana.sy/en/?p=56454 |title=Syria's ambassador to Russia urges all countries to join Syria and Russia against terrorism |author=Manal |agency=Syrian Arab News Agency}} the [[Russian Air Force|Russian Aerospace Forces]] began a sustained campaign of air strikes against both ISIL and the anti-Assad FSA.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-34413050 |title=Syria conflict: Russia launches fresh strikes – BBC News |publisher=BBC |accessdate=21 October 2015}}
{{cite web |url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/world/middle-east/72624688/russians-make-air-strikes-on-islamic-state-usbacked-syrian-rebel-targets |title=Russians make air strikes on Islamic State, US-backed Syrian rebel targets |publisher=stuff.co.nz |accessdate=21 October 2015}} Initially, the raids were conducted solely by Russian aircraft stationed in the [[Khmeimim Air Base]] in Syria. Shortly after the start of the Russian operation, U.S. president Barack Obama was reported to have authorized the resupply of Syrian Kurds and the Arab-Syrian opposition, Obama reportedly emphasizing to his team that the U.S. would continue to support the Syrian opposition now that Russia had joined the conflict.{{cite web |url=http://edition.cnn.com/2015/10/05/politics/russia-ground-campaign-syria-isis/ |title=Obama authorizes resupply of Syrian opposition |publisher=CNN |accessdate=21 October 2015}} On 7 October 2015, Russian officials said the ships of the [[Caspian Flotilla]] had earlier that day fired 26 [[3M-54 Klub|sea-based cruise missiles]] at 11 ISIL targets in Syria destroying those and causing no civilian casualties. That day, the Syrian government launched the [[Northwestern Syria offensive (October 2015)|northwest Syrian offensive]]{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-34465425 |title=Russian missiles 'hit IS in Syria from Caspian Sea' |date=7 October 2015 |work=BBC News}}
{{cite web |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2015/10/07/us-mideast-crisis-syria-nato-idUSKCN0S11UP20151007 |title=Russia has ground troop battalion, advanced tanks in Syria: U.S. NATO envoy |date=7 October 2015 |agency=Reuters |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151011134614/https://www.reuters.com/article/2015/10/07/us-mideast-crisis-syria-nato-idUSKCN0S11UP20151007 |archivedate=11 October 2015 |df=dmy-all }} that in the following few days succeeded in recapturing some territory in northern [[Hama Governorate]], close to the government's coastal heartland in the west of the country.{{cite web |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2015/10/12/us-mideast-crisis-syria-russia-idUSKCN0S60RT20151012 |title=Syrian army, Russian jets drive back rebels in fiercest clashes for days: monitor |date=12 October 2015 |agency=Reuters}} On 8 October 2015, the U.S. officially announced the end of the Pentagon's half-billion dollar program to train and equip Syrian rebels and acknowledged that it had failed{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/10/10/world/middleeast/pentagon-program-islamic-state-syria.html?&hp&action=click&pgtype=Homepage&module=first-column-region®ion=top-news&WT.nav=top-news |title=Obama Administration Ends Pentagon Program to Train Syrian Rebels |work=The New York Times |accessdate=9 October 2015 |date=9 October 2015}} However, other covert and significantly larger{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/10/13/world/middleeast/syria-russia-airstrikes.html|title=U.S. Weaponry Is Turning Syria Into Proxy War With Russia |work=The New York Times |accessdate=14 October 2015 |date=12 October 2015}} CIA programs to arm anti-government fighters in Syria continued.{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/oct/09/us-to-axe-5-scheme-train-syrian-rebels-nyt |title=US axes $500m scheme to train Syrian rebels, says NYT |work=The Guardian |accessdate=13 October 2015 |date=9 October 2015}}
{{cite web |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/national-security/lawmakers-move-to-curb-1-billion-cia-program-to-train-syrian-rebels/2015/06/12/b0f45a9e-1114-11e5-adec-e82f8395c032_story.html |title=Secret CIA effort in Syria faces large funding cut |work=The Washington Post |accessdate=13 October 2015 |date=10 June 2015}} [[File:Secretary Kerry Meets With Turkish Foreign Minister Sinirlioglu, Saudi Foreign Minister al-Jubeir, and Russian Foreign Minister Lavrov Before Quadrilateral Meeting in Austria Focused on Syria (22580971515).jpg|thumb|The foreign ministers of Russia, the U.S., Saudi Arabia, and Turkey in [[Syria peace talks in Vienna|Vienna]], before a four-way discussion focused on Syria, 29 October 2015]] Two weeks after the start of the Russian campaign in Syria, ''[[The New York Times]]'' opined that with anti-government commanders receiving for the first time bountiful supplies of U.S.-made anti-tank missiles and with Russia raising the number of airstrikes against the government's opponents that had raised morale in both camps, broadening war objectives and hardening political positions, the conflict was turning into an all-out [[proxy war]] between the U.S. and Russia. Despite multiple top-ranking casualties incurred by the Iranian forces advising fighters in Syria,{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/iranian-commander-brigadier-general-hossein-hamedani-killed-by-isis-while-advising-syrian-regime-a6687276.html |title=Iranian commander Brigadier General Hossein Hamedani killed by Isis while advising Syrian regime |author=Lizzie Dearden |date=9 October 2015 |work=The Independent}}
{{cite web |url=http://edition.cnn.com/2015/10/09/politics/iran-general-killed-syria-isis/ |title=Iran's involvement in Syria carries growing costs – U.S. official: 'Psychological blow' in ISIS killing of Iranian general in Syria |publisher=CNN |accessdate=21 October 2015}}
{{cite web |url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2015/10/iranian-commanders-killed-syria-151013192529038.html |title=Two more Iranian commanders killed in Syria |publisher=Al Jazeera |accessdate=14 October 2015 |date=13 September 2015}} in mid-October the [[Aleppo offensive (October 2015 – present)|Russian-Syrian-Iranian-Hezbollah offensive]] targeting rebels in Aleppo went ahead.{{cite web |url=http://newsru.com/world/15oct2015/homs.html |title=Новости NEWSru.com :: Сирийская армия при поддержке российской авиации пошла в атаку на позиции повстанцев под Хомсом |publisher=newsru.com |accessdate=21 October 2015}}
{{cite web |url=http://www.euronews.com/2015/10/14/syria-and-allies-iran-and-russia-prepare-for-aleppo-offensive/ |title=Syria and allies Iran and Russia prepare for Aleppo offensive |publisher=euronews.com |accessdate=21 October 2015}}
{{cite web |url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2015/10/14/uk-mideast-crisis-syria-rebels-idUKKCN0S71VO20151014 |title=Syria's army, allies plan offensive against insurgents in Aleppo |agency=Reuters |accessdate=14 October 2015 |date=14 October 2015}}
{{cite web |url=http://english.farsnews.com/newstext.aspx?nn=13940722000592 |title=Syrian Army, Hezbollah, Russian Air Force Coordinating for Aleppo Liberation Operation |agency=FARS News Agency |date=14 October 2015 |accessdate=21 October 2015}}
{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-34553148 |title=Syria conflict: Army launches new Aleppo offensive |work=BBC News|accessdate=17 October 2015 |date=16 October 2015}} At the end of October 2015, the U.S. Secretary of Defense [[Ashton Carter]] signalled a shift in the strategy of the U.S.-led campaign saying there will be more air strikes and ruling in the use of direct ground raids, the fight in Syria concentrating mostly on Raqqa.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-34654693 |title=US signals shift in Syria-Iraq campaign against Islamic State |work=BBC News|accessdate=29 October 2015 |date=28 October 2015}} On 30 October and two weeks later, [[Syria peace talks in Vienna|Syria peace talks]] were held in Vienna, initiated by the United States, Russia, Turkey and Saudi Arabia, in which on 30 October Iran participated for the first time in negotiations on Syrian settlement.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-34663093 |title=Syria conflict: John Kerry seeks end to civil war 'hell' |work=BBC News|accessdate=29 October 2015 |date=29 October 2015}} The participants disagreed on the future of Bashar Assad. On 10 November 2015, the Syrian government forces completed the [[Kuweires offensive (September–November 2015)|operation to break through]] the Islamic State insurgents' blockade of the Kweires air base in Aleppo Province, where government forces had been under siege since April 2013.{{cite web |url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2015/11/10/uk-mideast-crisis-syria-base-idUKKCN0SZ1OB20151110 |title=Syrian army enters Aleppo air base after Islamic State siege – state TV |agency=Reuters |accessdate=11 November 2015 |date=10 November 2015}} In mid-November 2015, in the wake of the [[Metrojet Flight 9268|Russian plane bombing over Sinai]] and the [[November 2015 Paris attacks|Paris attacks]], both Russia{{cite web |url=http://tass.ru/en/defense/837226 |title=TASS: Military & Defense – Russia involves strategic missile carriers in operation against Islamic State in Syria |agency=TASS}}{{cite web |url=https://www.rt.com/news/322436-russia-strikes-syria-putin/ |title=Long-range bombers to fly anti-ISIS missions from Russia, Putin orders Navy to work with France |publisher=RT English}} and France significantly intensified their strikes in Syria, France closely coordinating with the U.S. military.{{cite web |url=http://edition.cnn.com/2015/11/16/middleeast/france-raqqa-airstrikes-on-isis/ |title=French jets bomb ISIS stronghold of Raqqa, Syria; few may have been killed |publisher=CNN |date=16 November 2015 |accessdate=20 November 2015}} On 17 November, Putin said he had issued orders for the [[Russian cruiser Moskva|cruiser ''Moskva'']] that had been in eastern Mediterranean since the start of the Russian operations to "work as with an ally",[http://www.interfax.ru/world/479841 Путин поручил ВМФ РФ установить контакт с военно-морской группой Франции] [[Interfax]], 17 November 2015.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-34849063 |title=Russia steps up attacks against IS with missile bombardment |work=BBC News|date=18 November 2015 |accessdate=19 November 2015}} with the French naval group led by flagship [[French aircraft carrier Charles de Gaulle (R91)|''Charles De Gaulle'']] that had been on her way to eastern Mediterranean since early November.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-34738177 |title=France to deploy largest warship in mission against IS |work=BBC News|date=5 November 2015 |accessdate=18 November 2015}} Shortly afterwards, a Russian foreign ministry official criticised France's stridently anti-Assad stance as well as France's air strikes at oil and gas installations in Syria{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/nov/14/france-active-policy-syria-assad-isis-paris-attacks-air-strikes |title=France more active than rest of the west in tackling Syria |work=The Guardian |date=18 November 2015 |accessdate=19 November 2015}} as apparently designed to prevent those from returning under the Syrian government's control; the Russian official said that such strikes by France could not be justified as they were carried out without the Syrian government's consent.[http://ria.ru/syria/20151120/1324636454.html МИД РФ: удары Парижа по инфраструктуре Сирии не оправданы самообороной] RIA Novosti, 20 November 2015.
[http://kommersant.ru/doc/2857933 «Если ничего не предпринимать, то террористическая угроза приобретет для нас еще более серьезные масштабы»] ''[[Kommersant]]'', 20 November 2015. In his remarks to a French delegation that included French parliamentarians, on 14 November, President Bashar Assad sharply criticised France's as well as other Western States' actions against the Syrian government suggesting that French support for Syrian opposition forces had led to the Islamic State-claimed attacks in Paris.[http://sana.sy/en/?p=61231 President al-Assad to French delegation: Terrorist attacks on Paris can’t be separated from those of Beirut and events in Syria] Sana, 14 November 2015.
{{cite web |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/assad-says-paris-attacks-result-from-frances-aiding-rebels-in-syria/2015/11/14/287f7576-8adc-11e5-bd91-d385b244482f_story.html |title=Syria's President Assad says Paris attacks result from France's aiding of rebels |author=Hugh Naylor |work=The Washington Post |date=14 November 2015 |accessdate=20 November 2015}} On 19 November 2015, U.S. President Barack Obama, speaking of the Vienna process, said he was unable to "foresee a situation in which we can end the civil war in Syria while Assad remains in power"; he urged Russia and Iran to stop supporting the Syrian government.{{cite web |url=https://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/2015/11/19/remarks-president-obama-and-prime-minister-trudeau-canada-after |title=Remarks by President Obama and Prime Minister Trudeau of Canada After Bilateral Meeting |publisher=The U.S. White House |date=19 November 2015 |accessdate=20 November 2015}}
{{cite web |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2015/11/19/us-apec-summit-obama-syria-idUSKCN0T80KP20151119#Fw1kLTz6Oo6zuGdk.97 |title=Obama says Syria settlement needed to eliminate Islamic State |agency=Reuters |date=18 November 2015 |accessdate=20 November 2015}} On 20 November 2015, the U.N. Security Council, while failing to invoke the UN's [[Chapter VII of the United Nations Charter|Chapter VII]], which gives specific legal authorisation for the use of force,{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-34886971 |title=Paris attacks: UN backs 'all necessary measures' against IS |publisher=BBC |date=21 November 2015 |accessdate=21 November 2015}} unanimously passed [[United Nations Security Council Resolution 2249|Resolution 2249]] that urged UN members to "redouble and coordinate their efforts to prevent and suppress terrorist acts committed specifically by ISIL also known as Da'esh as well as ANF, and all other individuals, groups, undertakings, and entities associated with Al-Qaida, and other terrorist groups, as designated by the United Nations Security Council, and as may further be agreed by the [[Syria peace talks in Vienna|International Syria Support Group]] (ISSG) and endorsed by the UN Security Council".{{cite web |url=https://www.un.org/press/en/2015/sc12132.doc.htm |title=Security Council 'Unequivocally' Condemns ISIL Terrorist Attacks, Unanimously Adopting Text that Determines Extremist Group Poses 'Unprecedented' Threat |publisher=United Nations}} The adopted resolution was drafted by France and co-sponsored by the UK{{cite web |title=Cameron hails UN backing for action against Islamic State |work=BBC News|date=21 November 2015 |accessdate=21 November 2015}} the following day after Russia introduced an updated version of its previously submitted draft resolution that was blocked by the Western powers as seeking to legitimise Assad's authority.{{cite web |url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-n-security-council-unanimously-votes-to-adopt-frances-counterterrorism-resolution-1448062499 |title=U.N. Security Council Unanimously Votes to Adopt France's Counterterrorism Resolution |work=The Wall Street Journal |date=20 November 2015 |accessdate=21 November 2015}}{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/nov/21/un-calls-for-all-able-member-states-to-join-fight-against-isis |title=Security council unanimously calls on UN members to fight Isis |work=The Guardian |date=21 November 2015 |accessdate=21 November 2015}} On 24 November 2015, Turkey [[2015 Russian Sukhoi Su-24 shootdown|shot down a Russian warplane]] that allegedly violated Turkish airspace and crashed in northwestern Syria, leading to the Russian pilot's death. Following the crash, it was reported that [[Syrian Turkmen]] rebels from [[Syrian Turkmen Brigades]] attacked and shot down a Russian rescue helicopter, killing a Russian naval infantryman.{{cite news |url=http://news.nationalpost.com/news/turkey-blasts-russian-warplane-out-of-the-sky-says-jet-violated-its-airspace-pilots-fate-unclear |title=Syrian rebels fired on parachuting Russian pilots, killing at least one after Turkey shot down warplane: official |newspaper=[[National Post]] |date=25 November 2015 |accessdate=25 November 2015}} A few days after, Russian aircraft were reported to have struck targets in the Syrian town of [[Ariha, Syria|Ariha]] in Idlib province that was controlled by the [[Army of Conquest]] causing multiple casualties on the ground.{{cite web |url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2015/11/20-killed-russian-air-strike-syrian-market-151129082103978.html |title=Deadly 'Russian airstrike' hits market in Syria's Idlib |publisher=Al Jazeera |date=29 November 2015 |accessdate=29 November 2015}}{{cite web |url=http://newsru.com/world/29nov2015/ariha.html |title=Российская авиация в Сирии разбомбила овощной рынок: минимум 40 погибших |publisher=[[NEWSru]] |date=29 November 2015 |accessdate=29 November 2015}} On 2 December 2015, the [[Parliament of the United Kingdom]] voted to expand [[Operation Shader]] into Syria with a majority of 397–223.{{cite web |title=MPs approve motion on ISIL in Syria |url=http://www.parliament.uk/business/news/2015/december/mps-debate-motion-on-isil-in-syria/ |publisher=UK Parliament |accessdate=5 December 2015 |date=2 December 2015}} That day, two British [[Panavia Tornado|Tornado]] aircraft took off from [[RAF Akrotiri]] immediately at 22:30, each carrying three [[Paveway]] bombs. Two further aircraft were deployed at 00:30 on 3 December, and all aircraft returned by 06:30 without their bombs.{{cite news |title=Syria air strikes: What you need to know |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-34931421 |accessdate=12 December 2015 |work=BBC News|date=3 December 2015}} [[Secretary of State for Defence|UK Defence Secretary]] [[Michael Fallon]] said that the strikes hit the [[Omar, Syria|Omar]] oil fields in eastern Syria, and that eight more jets (two Tornados and six [[Eurofighter Typhoon|Typhoons]]) were being sent to RAF Akrotiri to join the eight already there.{{cite news |title=Syria air strikes: RAF Tornado jets carry out bombing |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-34992032 |accessdate=3 December 2015 |work=BBC News|date=3 December 2015}} On 7 December 2015, the government of Syria said US-led coalition warplanes had fired nine missiles at its army camp near Ayyash, [[Deir ez-Zor Governorate|Deir al-Zour province]], on the evening prior, killing three soldiers and wounding 13 others; three armoured vehicles, four military vehicles, heavy machine-guns and an arms and ammunition depot were also destroyed.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-35024408 |title=Syria conflict: Coalition denies air strike on army camp |work=BBC News|date=7 December 2015 |accessdate=7 December 2015}} The government condemned the strikes, the first time the government forces would be struck by the coalition,{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/us-led-coalition-air-strike-targets-syrian-soldiers-in-first-fatal-bombing-on-assad-regime-a6762956.html |title=Syria calls US-led coalition air strike on Assad regime forces an 'act of aggression' |work=The Independent |date=7 December 2015 |accessdate=7 December 2015}} as an act of "flagrant aggression"; the coalition spokesman denied it was responsible. Anonymous Pentagon officials alleged later in the day that the Pentagon was "certain" that a Russian warplane (presumably a [[Tupolev Tu-22M|TU-22 bomber]]) had carried out the attack.{{cite web |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/middle_east/us-denies-syrian-accusations-that-its-warplanes-hit-a-syrian-base/2015/12/07/db72a0fb-cc62-49c8-a5ed-997c2e6e1f98_story.html |title=Pentagon says Russian — not American — warplanes hit a Syrian army base |work=The Washington Post |date=7 December 2015 |accessdate=9 December 2015}}{{cite web |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-syria-idUSKBN0TQ2VG20151208#ZjS49yH0CDYiahGV.97 |title=Washington denies U.S.-led coalition hit Syria army camp |agency=Reuters |date=8 December 2015 |accessdate=9 December 2015}} The claim was denied by the Russian military spokesman.{{cite web |url=https://www.rt.com/news/325179-coalition-jets-syrian-army-attack/ |title=4 US-led coalition jets seen over Deir ez Zor in Syria day govt troops attacked – Russian MoD |publisher=RT |date=7 December 2015 |accessdate=9 December 2015}} On 14 December 2015, Russia's government news media reported that the Syrian government forces retook a [[Marj al-Sultan]] military airbase east of Damascus that had been held by [[Jaysh al-Islam]].{{cite web |url=http://ria.ru/syria_chronicle/20151214/1341776728.html |title=Источник: сирийская армия вернула контроль над авиабазой близ Дамаска |author=Михаил Алаеддин |agency=RIA Novosti |date=14 December 2015 |accessdate=14 December 2015}} The [[United Nations Security Council Resolution 2254|UN resolution 2254]] of 18 December 2015 that endorsed the [[Syria peace talks in Vienna|ISSG]]'s transitional plan but did not clarify who would represent the Syrian opposition, while condemning terrorist groups like ISIL and al-Qaeda; it made no mention of the future role of Syrian President Bashar Assad.{{cite news |url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-syria-un-idUKKBN0U10J020151219 |title=U.N. endorses Syria peace plan in rare show of unity among big powers |agency=Reuters |accessdate=19 December 2015 |date=19 December 2015}}
{{cite news |url=http://america.aljazeera.com/articles/2015/12/18/syria-talks-falter-before-they-begin-as-key-players-struggle-to-agree-key.html |title=Differences remain as key sides meet for Syria talks |publisher=Al Jazeera |accessdate=19 December 2015 |date=18 December 2015}} On 12 January 2016, the Syria government announced that its army and allied forces had established "full control" of the strategically situated town of [[Salma, Syria|Salma]], whose pre-war population was predominantly Sunni,Balanche, 2006, p. 88. in the northwestern province of Latakia, and continued to advance north.{{cite news |url=http://english.alarabiya.net/en/News/middle-east/2016/01/12/Syrian-army-enters-rebel-bastion-in-Latakia-province.html |title=Syria army fully captures rebel redoubt in Latakia |publisher=Al Arabiya |accessdate=14 January 2016 |date=12 January 2016}}
{{cite web |url=http://sana.sy/en/?p=66448 |title=Syrian Army establishes control over four villages near Salma in Lattakia and another in Aleppo |author=h.said |publisher=sanasy}} On 16 January 2016, ISIL militants [[Deir ez-Zor offensive (January 2016)#Initial assault and massacre|launched raid]] on government-held areas in the city of [[Deir ez-Zor]] and killed up to 300 people.{{cite web |url=http://www.ibtimes.co.in/isis-massacre-least-300-killed-several-held-hostages-east-syria-663542 |title=Isis massacre: At least 300 killed, several held hostages in east Syria |work=International Business Times |date=17 January 2016}} Counter-strikes by [[Russian Air Force]] fighter jets, in support of Syrian army forces, were reported to take back the areas.{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/jan/17/dozens-killed-by-islamic-state-in-massacre-in-syrian-city-of-deir-ezzor |title=Dozens killed by Islamic State in 'massacre' in Syrian city of Deir ez-Zor |work=The Guardian |date=17 January 2016}} On 21 January 2016, Russia's activity presumably aimed at setting up a new base in the government-controlled [[Kamishly Airport]] was first reported;{{cite news |url=http://www.foxnews.com/us/2016/01/21/russians-survey-new-airbase-on-syria-turkey-border-us-officials-concerned.html |title=Russians survey new airbase on Syria-Turkey border, US officials concerned |publisher=[[Fox News Channel]] |accessdate=23 January 2016 |date=21 January 2016}}
{{cite news |url=http://newsru.com/world/23jan2016/newbases.html |title=Россия и США синхронно создают новые авиабазы на севере Сирии |publisher=NEWSru |accessdate=23 January 2016 |date=23 January 2016}}{{cite news |url=http://edition.cnn.com/2016/01/21/politics/russia-syria-air-base/ |title=U.S. officials: Russia looking at Syria airfield near Turkey |publisher=CNN |accessdate=23 January 2016 |date=22 January 2016}} the northeastern town of Qamishli in the [[Al-Hasakah Governorate]] had been largely under the Syrian Kurds' control since the start of the [[Syrian Kurdish–Islamist conflict (2013–present)|Syrian Kurdish–Islamist conflict]] in the governorate of Al-Hasakah in July 2013. Similar activity by the U.S. forces was suspected in the Rmeilan Airbase in the same province, {{convert|50|km|abbr=off}} away from the Kamishly Airport; the area is likewise controlled by the US-backed Kurdish [[People's Protection Units]] (YPG).{{cite web |url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2016/01/takes-control-rmeilan-airfield-syria-160119141331681.html |title=US 'takes control' of Rmeilan airfield in Syria |publisher=Al Jazeera}} On 24 January 2016, the Syrian government announced its forces, carrying on with their [[2015–16 Latakia offensive|Latakia offensive]], had seized the predominantly Sunni-populated town of [[Rabia, Syria|Rabia]], the last major town held by rebels in western Latakia province; Russian forces were said to have played an important role in the recapture.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-35395328 |title=Syria conflict: Major rebel town 'seized' in boost for Assad |publisher=BBC |accessdate=24 January 2016 |date=24 January 2016}} The capture of Rabia was said to threaten rebel supply lines from Turkey.[https://news.yahoo.com/syria-army-seizes-key-rebel-held-town-latakia-085537098.html Syria regime advances in northwest ahead of peace talks] AFP, 24 December 2016. By 26 January 2016, the Syrian government established "full control" over the town of [[Al-Shaykh Maskin]] in the [[Daraa Governorate]],{{cite web |url=http://sana.sy/en/?p=67552 |title=Update 4-Army establishes full control over al-Sheikh Miskeen in Daraa and a village in Aleppo |author=Barry Temmo |agency=Syrian Arab News Agency}}
[https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-syria-town-idUSKCN0V32P1 Syrian army seizes strategic town in Deraa province: monitor] Reuters, 25 January 2016. thus completing the [[Second Battle of Al-Shaykh Maskin|operation]] that had begun in late December 2015. The town's capture by the Syrian government was remarked as a "turning of the tide in the Syrian war" by [[Al-Jazeera]].[http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2016/01/syrian-army-captures-key-southern-town-rebels-160126040829177.html Tide turns in Syrian war with capture of key town] Al Jazeera, 26 December 2016. === Partial ceasefire (26 February–July 2016) === {{Main|Syria ceasefire}} [[File:Defence ministers of the three allied powers in the Syrian Civil War.jpg|thumb|Defense ministers of Russia, Iran and Syria in a tripartite meeting in Tehran]] On 26 February 2016, the [[United Nations Security Council]] unanimously adopted [[United Nations Security Council Resolution 2268|resolution 2268]] that endorsed a previously brokered U.S.-Russian deal on a "[[Geneva peace talks on Syria (2016)#Cessation of hostilities (27 February 2016)|cessation of hostilities]]".{{cite news |work=BBC News|date=26 February 2016 |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-35674908 |title=Temporary truce comes into effect}}
{{cite web |title=Joint Statement of the United States and the Russian Federation, as Co-Chairs of the ISSG, on Cessation of Hostilities in Syria |url=https://www.state.gov/r/pa/prs/ps/2016/02/253115.htm |publisher=U.S. Department of State |date=22 February 2016}} The cease-fire started on 27 February 2016 at 00:00 (Damascus time).{{cite news |agency=Reuters |date=26 February 2016 |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-syria-un-idUSKCN0VZ2WM |title=U.N. demands Syria parties halt fighting, peace talks set for March 7}} The ceasefire does not include attacks on UN-designated terrorist organizations.[https://www.theatlantic.com/international/archive/2016/02/syria-russia-ceasefire/470421/ A Potential Cease-Fire in Syria]. ''[[The Atlantic]]''. Published 22 February 2016. Retrieved 3 March 2016.[http://scroll.in/latest/804266/landmark-syria-ceasefire-begins-with-terrorist-groups-excluded Landmark Syria ceasefire begins, with terrorist groups excluded]. Scroll.in. Published 27 February 2016. Retrieved 3 March 2016. At the close of February 2016, despite individual clashes, the truce was reported to hold.{{cite news |work=BBC News|date=29 February 2016 |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-35683931 |title=Syria conflict: UN steps up aid deliveries as truce holds}} By the end of March, the Syrian government forces with support from Russia and Iran successfully [[Palmyra offensive (March 2016)|captured Palmyra]] from the ISIL.{{cite news |title=Syrian army, with Russian air support, advances inside Palmyra |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-syria-idUSKCN0WR0RA |agency=Reuters |date=26 March 2016}} [[File:Liberation of Palmyra by RSII coalition (1).jpg|thumb|[[Palmyra offensive (March 2016)|Palmyra offensive]] in March 2016]] By early July 2016, the truce was said to have mostly unraveled, violence again escalated, and the fighting between all the major parties to the conflict continued.{{cite web |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-syria-truce-idUSKCN0ZM0PZ |title=Syrian army, rebels agree to 72-hour Eid truce, but fighting continues |date=7 July 2016 |agency=Reuters}} At the end of July 2016, [[Aleppo offensive (June–August 2016)|the fighting between the government and Islamist rebels in and around Aleppo intensified]]. === SDF advances and Turkish military intervention (August–October 2016) === On 12 August 2016, the [[Syrian Democratic Forces]] fully [[Manbij offensive|captured]] [[Manbij]] from ISIL. Some days later, the SDF announced a new offensive towards [[Al-Bab]], which could eventually connect the Kurdish regions in Northern Syria.{{cite web |url=http://syriancivilwarmap.com/ |title=Syrian Civil War Map / Live Map of the Syrian Civil War |website=Syrian Civil War Map|access-date=17 August 2016}} A few days after, the [[Battle of al-Hasakah (2016)|battle of al-Hasakah]] began. On 22 August, the Kurdish YPG, having captured Ghwairan, the only major Arab neighborhood in Hasaka that had been in government hands, launched a major assault to seize the last government-controlled areas of the northeastern Syrian city of Hasaka, after a Russian mediation team failed to mend the rift between the two sides;{{cite web |url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2016/08/syria-ypg-launches-assault-hasaka-160822041843880.html |title=Syria: YPG launches assault to take all of Hasaka |publisher=[[Al Jazeera]]}} the next day the capture of the city was completed.{{cite web |last1=Perry |first1=Tom |first2=Rodi |last2=Said |title=Syria Kurds win battle with government, Turkey mobilises against them |url=http://in.reuters.com/article/mideast-crisis-syria-kurds-idINKCN10Y12O |agency=Reuters India |accessdate=8 January 2017 }} A few days prior, the Pentagon admonished the Syrian government against "interfering with coalition forces or our partners" in that region, adding that the U.S. had the right to defend its troops.{{cite web |last1=Ali |first1=Idrees |title=Coalition jets scrambled to defend U.S. forces from Syrian bombing |url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-mideast-crisis-usa-aircraft-idUKKCN10U1OS?il=0 |agency=Reuters UK |accessdate=8 January 2017}} On 24 August 2016, Turkey's armed forces invaded Syria in the [[Jarabulus]] area controlled by ISIL starting what the Turkish president called [[Battle of Jarabulus (2016)|Operation Euphrates Shield]], aimed against, according to his statement, both the IS and Kurdish "terror groups that threaten our country in northern Syria".{{cite web |url=http://www.france24.com/en/20160824-erdogan-says-syria-operation-aimed-jihadists-kurdish-pyd|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160825183523/http://www.france24.com/en/20160824-erdogan-says-syria-operation-aimed-jihadists-kurdish-pyd|dead-url=yes|archive-date=25 August 2016 |title=Erdogan says Syria operation aimed at IS jihadists, Kurdish PYD |date=24 August 2016 |publisher=France 24}}
[https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-37171995 Syria Jarablus: Turkish tanks roll into northern Syria] BBC. 24 August 2016.
[https://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/aug/24/turkey-launches-major-operation-against-isis-in-key-border-town Turkey sends tanks into Syria in operation aimed at Isis and Kurds] The Guardian, 24 August 2016. The Syrian government denounced the intervention as a "blatant violation of its sovereignty" and said that "fighting terrorism isn't done by ousting ISIS and replacing it with other terrorist organizations backed directly by Turkey".[http://sana.sy/en/?p=86277 Syria condemns Turkey’s breach of Syria’s sovereignty in Jarablos] Sana, 24 August 2016. The PYD leader [[Salih Muslim Muhammad|Salih Muslim]] said that Turkey was now in the "Syrian quagmire" and would be defeated like IS.{{cite web |url=http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/erdogan-to-pyd-those-issuing-threats-should-think-what-will-happen.aspx?PageID=238&NID=103176&NewsCatID=352 |title=Erdoğan to PYD: Those issuing threats should think about what will happen |work=Hürriyet Daily News}} Speaking in Ankara the same day, US vice president [[Joe Biden]] indirectly endorsed Turkey's move and said that the U.S. had made it clear to the Syrian Kurdish forces that they should move back east across the Euphrates, or lose US support.{{cite web |url=http://www.arabnews.com/node/974651/middle-east |title=Biden orders Syrian Kurds to pull back; Assad govt slams Turkish incursion |date=24 August 2016 |publisher=arabnews.com}}
[https://ria.ru/syria/20160824/1475162680.html Байден назвал условия, при которых США будут поддерживать курдов] [[RIA Novosti]]. As Turkish troops and the Turkish-aligned Syrian rebels took control of Jarablus and moved further south towards the Syrian town of Manbij, they clashed with the Kurdish YPG, which led the U.S. officials to voice concern and issue a warning to both sides.[https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-syria-idUSKCN11305C Turkish forces deepen push into Syria, draw U.S. rebuke over their target] Reuters, 29 August 2016.
{{cite web |url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2016/08/turkish-backed-syrian-rebels-advance-manbij-160829154225197.html |title=Turkish-backed Syrian rebels advance towards Manbij |publisher=Al Jazeera}} On 29 August, U.S. Defense Secretary [[Ash Carter]] specified that the U.S. did not support Turkey's advance south of Jarablus.{{cite web |url=http://www.voanews.com/a/us-condemns-clashes-between-turkish-and-allied-kurdish-forces/3484741.html |title=Carter Calls on Turkey to 'Stay Focused' on Islamic State |first=Carla |last=Babb |publisher=VoA}} The warning as well as an announcement made by the U.S. of a tentative ceasefire between the Turkish forces and the Kurds in the area of Jarablus were promptly and angrily dismissed by Turkey's officials.{{cite web |url=http://www.dailysabah.com/diplomacy/2016/08/30/us-comments-about-turkeys-targets-in-syria-unacceptable-says-turkish-mfa |title=US' comments about Turkey's targets in Syria unacceptable, says Turkish MFA |work=Daily Sabah |date=30 August 2016 |accessdate=31 August 2016}}
{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-37231760 |title=Syria war: Turkey hits out at US over Kurds comments |publisher=BBC |date=31 August 2016}} However, combat between the Turkish forces and the SDF died down, and instead Turkish forces moved West to confront IS.{{cite web |title=Turkey pushes west in Syrian offensive |url=http://www.news.com.au/world/breaking-news/turkey-pushes-west-in-syrian-offensive/news-story/562f05093dd0dad72e6a2d4c7b09c597 |publisher=[[News.com.au]] |accessdate=8 January 2017 |date=2 September 2016}} In the meantime the SDF, including Western volunteers, continued to reinforce Manbij.{{cite web |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-syria-turkey-city-idUSKCN1140EU |title=Syrian Kurdish spokesman says Manbij reinforced, but not by YPG |date=29 August 2016 |agency=Reuters}} At sunset on 12 September 2016, a [[Syrian Civil War ceasefires#Second ceasefire (12th September – 20th September)|U.S.-Russian brokered cease-fire]] came into effect.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-37335829 |title=Syrian Army uses ceasefire |date=12 September 2016 |publisher=BBC World News |access-date=12 September 2016}} Five days later, the U.S. and other coalition members' jets [[September 2016 Deir ez-Zor air raid|bombed Syrian Army positions]] near Deir ez-Zor—purportedly by accident, but with Russia contending that it was intentional—killing at least 62 Syrian troops that were fighting ISIL militants.{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/sep/17/russia-says-us-led-airstrikes-hit-syrian-troops-killing-62-and-wounding-dozens |title=UN security council to hold emergency meeting on US air strikes in Syria |date=17 September 2016 |newspaper=The Guardian|access-date=8 October 2016}} Shortly after, the ceasefire broke down, and on 19 September the Syrian Army declared to no longer observe the truce.{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/sep/19/syria-ceasefire-is-over-says-countrys-military |title=US blames Russia after UN aid convoy in Syria targeted by air attack |newspaper=The Guardian |author=Julian Borger |date=20 September 2016 |accessdate=15 October 2016}} Also on 19 September, an [[September 2016 Aleppo Aid Convoy Attack|aid convoy in Aleppo was attacked]] with the U.S. coalition blaming the Russian and Syrian governments for the attack and these same governments denying these accusation and instead blaming terrorists for the attack. On 22 September, the Syrian army declared a [[Aleppo offensive (September 2016)|new offensive in Aleppo]].{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-37446580 |title=Syria conflict: Army declares offensive in eastern Aleppo |date=23 September 2016 |publisher=BBC World News|access-date=12 September 2016}} The offensive succeeded on 14 December, when the final Rebel stronghold in Aleppo was recaptured by the Syrian government followed by a ceasefire agreement.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-38297511 |title=Recapture of Aleppo: What next for Syria? |date=15 December 2016 |publisher=BBC World News|access-date=15 December 2016}}
{{cite news |url=http://www.cnn.com/2016/12/12/middleeast/aleppo-syria-government-gains/index.html |title=Russia: Syria establishes control over eastern Aleppo |date=15 December 2016 |publisher=CNN|access-date=15 December 2016}} On 26 October 2016 US Defense Secretary [[Ash Carter]] said that an offensive to retake Raqqa from IS will begin within weeks.{{Cite news |url=http://www.nbcnews.com/storyline/isis-uncovered/raqqa-offensive-against-isis-begin-within-weeks-ash-carter-n672996 |title=Raqqa Offensive Against ISIS to Begin Within Weeks: Ash Carter |last=Nichols|first=Hans|date=26 October 2016 |publisher=NBC News |last2=Burton|first2=F. BRrinley|access-date=26 October 2016}} The SDF proceeded with this effort, in operation [[Wrath of Euphrates]]. This operation used up to 30,000 Arab, Christian and Kurdish troops, with support from the Western Coalition. By December 2016 it had captured many villages and land west of Raqqa, previously controlled by IS.{{cite web |title='Wrath on the Euphrates' as US-backed forces launch operation to seize Raqqa from Isil's grip |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/11/06/us-backed-forces-announce-operation-to-seize-raqqa-from-isils-gr/ |website=The Telegraph |accessdate=8 January 2017}} By January 2017, much of the land west of Raqqa had been seized, and the second phase of the operation was complete. === Russian/Iranian/Turkish backed ceasefire (December 2016 – April 2017) === [[File:Lions of the East Army rocket artillery.png|thumb|A [[BM-21 Grad]] [[rocket artillery]] truck of the [[Lions of the East Army]] during the [[2017 southern Syrian Desert campaign]]]] In December 2016, Syrian government forces [[Aleppo offensive (November–December 2016)|completely recaptured]] all of rebel-held parts of [[Aleppo]], ending the 4-year battle in the city.{{cite news |url=http://www.upi.com/Top_News/World-News/2016/12/03/Assads-forces-retake-half-of-rebel-held-Aleppo/3411480810004/ |first=Eric |last=DuVall |title=Assad's forces retake half of rebel-held Aleppo |agency=[[United Press International]] |date=3 December 2016}}
{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-38194136 |author=Staff writer(s) |title=Aleppo siege: Syria rebels lose 50% of territory |publisher=BBC |date=3 December 2016}} On 15 December, as it was reported government forces were on the brink of retaking all of Aleppo—a "turning point" in the civil war, Assad celebrated the "liberation" of the city, and stated, "History is being written by every Syrian citizen."{{cite web |url=http://fox6now.com/2016/12/17/evacuation-agreement-reached-in-aleppo-rebel-group-says/ |title=Evacuation agreement reached in Aleppo, rebel group says |author=Staff writer(s) |publisher=Fox 6 Now |date=17 December 2016 |accessdate=21 December 2016}} On 29 December 2016 Russian President Vladimir Putin announced a new ceasefire deal had been reached between the Syrian Government and opposition groups, with Russia and Turkey acting as guarantors, and Iran as a signatory to a trilateral agreement. The ceasefire came into effect at 00:00 Syrian time (02:00 UTC) on 30 December. It does not include UN-designated terrorist groups, such as ISIL and Jabhat Fateh al-Sham. Syrian High Negotiations Committee representatives in Turkey confirmed that they were involved in the deal. Talks were scheduled to be held between the groups in Astana, the capital of Kazakhstan, on 15 January.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-38460127 |title=Syria conflict: Ceasefire agreed, backed by Russia and Turkey |date=29 December 2016 |publisher=BBC World News |accessdate=29 December 2016}} Early reports indicated that despite sporadic fighting incidents, the ceasefire appeared to be holding, with no civilian deaths.{{cite web |url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2016/12/russia-turkey-broker-nationwide-ceasefire-deal-161229154943609.html |title=Russia, Turkey broker 'nationwide' ceasefire deal |date=30 December 2016 |publisher=Al Jazeera |access-date=30 December 2016}} Also late on 29 December, the [[United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs]] reported that four million people in Damascus and surrounding areas were without reliable access to water after major supply infrastructure was subject to deliberate targeting on 22 December. They said that although the government had initiated a program of rationing, they were concerned that safe water may not be accessible to everyone and called on parties to reach peaceful agreements to guarantee basic services. On 2 January 2017, rebel groups said that they would disengage from planned talks after alleged ceasefire violations by Government forces in the Wadi [[Barada]] valley near Damascus. The government says the region is excluded from the ceasefire because of the presence of Fatah al-Sham, but some local activists deny that they have a presence there.{{cite web |url=https://apnews.com/0f807697edfb426198bc347ff63b86d2/Syria-rebels-suspend-talks-over-alleged-truce-violations |title=Syria rebels suspend talks over alleged truce violations |last=Zeina |first=Karam |date=3 January 2017 |agency=Associated Press|access-date=3 January 2017}} At the end of January, government forces managed to [[Siege of Wadi Barada|capture Wadi Barada]] and the water supply of Damascus was restored.{{cite web |url=http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=59940 |title=The Syrian flag is raised in Al-Feja Spring |work=SOHR |date=28 January 2017 |accessdate=28 January 2017}}{{cite web |url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2017/01/syrian-army-captures-wadi-barada-170129131830656.html |title=Syrian army captures Wadi Barada |publisher=Al Jazeera |date=29 January 2017 |accessdate=29 January 2017}} On 14 February 2017, the cease-fire between Assad forces and rebels collapsed throughout the country, leading to fresh clashes in various locations and a [[Daraa offensive (February 2017)|fresh rebel offensive in Daraa]].{{cite web
